      33             : /**
      34             :  * This is a cairo/Thebes-only, main-thread-only implementation of layers.
      35             :  * 
      36             :  * In each transaction, the client sets up the layer tree and then during
      37             :  * the drawing phase, each PaintedLayer is painted directly into the target
      38             :  * context (with appropriate clipping and Push/PopGroups performed
      39             :  * between layers).
      40             :  */
      41             : class BasicLayerManager final :
      42             :     public LayerManager
      43             : {
      44             : public:
      45             :   enum BasicLayerManagerType {
      46             :     BLM_WIDGET,
      47             :     BLM_OFFSCREEN,
      48             :     BLM_INACTIVE
      49             :   };
      50             :   /**
      51             :    * Construct a BasicLayerManager which will have no default
      52             :    * target context. SetDefaultTarget or BeginTransactionWithTarget
      53             :    * must be called for any rendering to happen. PaintedLayers will not
      54             :    * be retained.
      55             :    */
      56             :   explicit BasicLayerManager(BasicLayerManagerType aType);
      57             :   /**
      58             :    * Construct a BasicLayerManager which will have no default
      59             :    * target context. SetDefaultTarget or BeginTransactionWithTarget
      60             :    * must be called for any rendering to happen. PaintedLayers will be
      61             :    * retained; that is, we will try to retain the visible contents of
      62             :    * PaintedLayers as cairo surfaces. We create PaintedLayer buffers by
      63             :    * creating similar surfaces to the default target context, or to
      64             :    * aWidget's GetThebesSurface if there is no default target context, or
      65             :    * to the passed-in context if there is no widget and no default
      66             :    * target context.
      67             :    * 
      68             :    * This does not keep a strong reference to the widget, so the caller
      69             :    * must ensure that the widget outlives the layer manager or call
      70             :    * ClearWidget before the widget dies.
      71             :    */
      72             :   explicit BasicLayerManager(nsIWidget* aWidget);
      73             : 
      74             : protected:
      75             :   virtual ~BasicLayerManager();
      76             : 
      77             : public:
      78             :   BasicLayerManager* AsBasicLayerManager() override { return this; }
      79             : 
      80             :   /**
      81             :    * Set the default target context that will be used when BeginTransaction
      82             :    * is called. This can only be called outside a transaction.
      83             :    * 
      84             :    * aDoubleBuffering can request double-buffering for drawing to the
      85             :    * default target. When BUFFERED, the layer manager avoids blitting
      86             :    * temporary results to aContext and then overpainting them with final
      87             :    * results, by using a temporary buffer when necessary. In BUFFERED
      88             :    * mode we always completely overwrite the contents of aContext's
      89             :    * destination surface (within the clip region) using OP_SOURCE.
      90             :    */
